page.title: 17Beckingham(Lincs) _ Church
page.content: At Beckingham as in so many villages it is the church which has the most obvious connection with the past. There was a church and a priest here at the time of the original Domesday Book and there is a church and a priest here today. Although the church today is much larger than in the eleventh century when it would have been no larger than the present chancel it is sadly in a poor state of repair. Rain comes in through the roof of the nave and the whole structure is suffering from neglect. The only improvement made in recent years has been to the 19th. century clock which has been electrified. The eighteenth century rectory is one of the largest in the county and similarly the living at Beckingham was one of the most lucrative.
